```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggcorrplot)
library(tidyverse)
```
notes: need 10 in rating variable to be at the end

```{r}
coaster_data <- read.csv("FileName.csv")
# data exploration
pairs(coaster_data[,c(5,6,7,8,9,10,11,14)])

corr_matrix <- model.matrix(~0+., data=coaster_data[,c(14,8,9,10,11)]) %>% 
  cor(use="pairwise.complete.obs") %>% 
  ggcorrplot(show.diag = F, type="lower", lab=TRUE, lab_size=2, title = "Correlation Matrix")
corr_matrix

ggplot( data= coaster_data, aes(x=speed.x, y=height.x, color=Rating)) + geom_point()
ggplot( data= coaster_data, aes(x=speed.x, y=length.x, color=Rating)) + geom_point()
ggplot( data= coaster_data, aes(x=speed.x, y=score, color=material_type)) + geom_point()
#ggplot( data= coaster_data, aes(x=speed.x, y=score, color=manufacturer)) + geom_point()
ggplot( data= coaster_data, aes(x=speed.x, y=height.x, color=num_inversions)) + geom_point()



```
